subject: Automobile Racing
lead_paragraph: The Indy Racing League will not return to Nashville Superspeedway after efforts to negotiate an agreement for a 2009 race failed. The IndyCar Series had raced at the track the past eight years, including July 12, when Scott Dixon won a rain-shortened race. The Edmonton Sun reported Sunday that Toronto would replace Nashville in an 18-race schedule in 2009. Nashville had been the only concrete track on the I.R.L. circuit, and drivers had been unhappy with the difficulty of passing on the 1.33-mile oval.
